description: Canonical OSSS constraint registry with semantic definitions and lifecycle management

constraints.description: A team cannot be scheduled for overlapping fixtures

references.rationale: Physical impossibility - a team cannot be in two places at once

constraints.description: A venue resource cannot host overlapping fixtures

references.rationale: Physical impossibility - a venue can only host one match at a time

constraints.description: Minimum rest time required between fixtures

min_hours.description: Minimum hours between fixture end and next fixture start

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty increases linearly with hours below minimum

references.rationale: Player recovery, injury prevention, and operational logistics

constraints.description: Maximum games a team can play in a single day

max_games.description: Maximum number of games per calendar day

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty doubles for each additional game beyond max

references.rationale: Player welfare, performance quality, injury prevention

constraints.description: Fixtures must fall within venue availability windows

references.rationale: Venues have operational constraints (maintenance, shared usage, opening hours)
useCases: All leagues with limited venue access
references.note: Availability windows should be defined in venue.availability array

constraints.description: Maximum allowable travel distance between consecutive fixtures

max_km.description: Maximum kilometers from team home to fixture venue

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty per kilometer over the maximum

references.rationale: Cost control, player welfare, environmental impact, fairness

constraints.description: Minimize total travel distance across all fixtures

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty per kilometer of total travel distance

references.rationale: Cost efficiency, environmental impact, player fatigue reduction

constraints.description: Balance the number of home and away games for each team

max_delta.description: Maximum allowable difference between home and away game counts

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty increases quadratically with imbalance (1 game = 15, 2 games = 60, 3 games = 135)

references.rationale: Competitive fairness, revenue equity (for ticketed games), fan experience
references.note: Critical for leagues where home advantage is significant

constraints.description: Ensure minimum spacing between repeat matchups against the same opponent

min_days.description: Minimum days between fixtures against the same opponent

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty per day below minimum spacing

references.rationale: Competitive variety, fan engagement, strategic preparation time, fairness

constraints.description: Fixtures must occur within broadcast-approved time windows

defaultPenaltyModel.description: High flat penalty for broadcast contract violations

references.rationale: Broadcast contract compliance, revenue maximization, viewership optimization
references.note: Often a hard constraint due to contractual obligations worth millions

constraints.description: Ensure fair network latency conditions for all teams in esports matches

max_ping_ms.description: Maximum acceptable ping for any team in milliseconds

max_delta_ms.description: Maximum acceptable ping difference between teams in milliseconds

references.rationale: Competitive integrity - network latency creates unfair advantage similar to home field in traditional sports
references.note: Critical for maintaining competitive integrity in skill-based esports

constraints.description: Ensure fair distribution of match times across global regions in esports tournaments

regions.description: List of regions (e.g., NA, EU, APAC, LATAM)

primetime_windows.description: Map of region to primetime windows in local time

min_primetime_matches_per_team.description: Minimum number of matches each team should play in their home region primetime

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty for each match below minimum primetime allocation

references.rationale: Player welfare (reasonable local times), viewership fairness, competitive integrity
useCases: Global esports tournaments (LoL Worlds, CS:GO Majors)
Regional qualifiers spanning multiple time zones
references.note: Balancing global viewership with player welfare is unique to esports

constraints.description: Limit concurrent high-profile matches to maximize viewership and prevent audience fragmentation

max_concurrent_matches.description: Maximum number of matches that should occur simultaneously

match_priority_threshold.description: Priority score threshold above which matches count as 'high-profile' (0-1)

defaultPenaltyModel.description: High penalty for viewership cannibalization in revenue-driven esports

references.rationale: Revenue maximization, viewer experience, sponsor visibility
references.note: Unlike traditional sports, esports viewers can easily switch streams, making concurrent scheduling critical

constraints.description: Ensure teams play balanced distribution across home, neutral, and away servers

target_home_pct.description: Target percentage of matches on home region server

target_neutral_pct.description: Target percentage of matches on neutral server

target_away_pct.description: Target percentage of matches on opponent region server

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty increases quadratically with deviation from target distribution

references.rationale: Competitive fairness analogous to home/away balance in traditional sports
references.note: Experimental: server location assignment may be handled at different layer than scheduling

constraints.description: Fixtures must occur within specified time windows (days of week, times of day)

allowed_days.description: List of allowed days (e.g., Saturday, Sunday)

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Flat penalty for each fixture outside allowed windows

references.rationale: Youth leagues often restricted to weekends, broadcast schedules require specific times

constraints.description: Limit the maximum number of consecutive away games for a team

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty doubles for each game beyond maximum

references.rationale: Player fatigue, fan engagement (want home games), travel costs
useCases: All leagues - fan engagement and travel cost management

constraints.description: Limit the maximum number of consecutive home games for a team

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Linear penalty for each game beyond maximum

references.rationale: Competitive fairness - too many home games in a row can be unfair advantage

constraints.description: Minimum buffer time between fixtures at the same venue for setup/cleanup

min_minutes.description: Minimum buffer time in minutes between fixtures

references.rationale: Operational necessity - venues need time for cleanup, setup, fan exit/entry

constraints.description: Specific fixtures must occur on designated dates (e.g., rivalry games, holidays)

fixture_id.description: ID of the fixture that must be on specific date

time_window.description: Optional time window within the date

references.rationale: Broadcast contracts, traditions, holidays often require specific dates
references.note: Often contractually mandated - typically hard constraint

constraints.description: Limit or prevent teams from playing on consecutive days

max_consecutive_days.description: Maximum number of consecutive days a team can play

allow_back_to_back.description: Whether back-to-back games are allowed at all

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty doubles for each additional back-to-back day

references.rationale: Player fatigue and injury risk, especially in physical sports

constraints.description: Maximum games a team can play within a given time period (e.g., per week)

max_games.description: Maximum games allowed in the period

period_days.description: Length of the period in days (e.g., 7 for weekly)

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty doubles for each game over the limit

references.rationale: Player welfare and competitive integrity over longer periods
useCases: Dense schedules like ice hockey or basketball

constraints.description: Assign fixtures to specific venues based on capacity, surface, or other requirements

preferred_venues.description: Ordered list of preferred venue IDs

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty for assignment to non-preferred venue

references.rationale: Tournament scheduling often requires specific venue assignments

constraints.description: Preference for scheduling fixtures at specific venues

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty for not using preferred venue

references.rationale: Home ground advantage, fan accessibility, operational efficiency

constraints.description: Fixtures require specific weather conditions (e.g., outdoor/water sports)

references.rationale: Player safety and competitive integrity in outdoor sports

constraints.description: Prefer scheduling at venues with roof/cover when weather risk is high

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty for outdoor scheduling during high-risk weather periods

references.rationale: Reduce weather-related disruptions and cancellations

constraints.description: Fixtures require specific tide conditions (water sports)

references.rationale: Safety and competitive fairness in water sports

constraints.description: Minimum wave quality threshold for competition (surfing)

references.rationale: Competition integrity requires adequate wave conditions

constraints.description: Dynamic league split based on standings at a specific round. Teams are re-grouped into pools (e.g., Top 6 / Bottom 6) and only play within their new group for subsequent phases.

split_after_round.description: Round number after which the split occurs

groups.description: Definition of split groups by standing position

carry_over_points.description: Whether points from Phase 1 carry over to Phase 2

references.rationale: Split-season formats create competitive balance by grouping teams of similar ability in later phases
references.note: Requires dynamic fixture generation based on standings at split point

constraints.description: Limit the number of times two teams can play each other within a phase or the entire season

max_meetings.description: Maximum times two teams can meet in the specified scope

scope.description: Whether limit applies per phase or entire season

phase_id.description: Specific phase to apply limit (if scope is 'phase')

defaultPenaltyModel.description: High penalty for exceeding maximum meetings

references.rationale: Prevents fixture fatigue and maintains competitive variety

constraints.description: Allow controlled asymmetry in home/away game counts, common in odd-fixture formats like triple round-robin

max_imbalance.description: Maximum allowed difference between home and away games

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty per game beyond allowed imbalance

references.rationale: Some formats mathematically cannot have equal home/away - this constraint allows controlled asymmetry

constraints.description: Fixture is only scheduled if a condition is met (e.g., both teams in same split group)

condition_type.description: Type of condition that must be met

references.rationale: Enables dynamic fixture generation based on standings or group membership

constraints.description: Prevent overlapping fixtures at the same venue, with optional buffer time for turnaround

bufferMinutes.description: Minimum minutes between fixtures at same venue

includeSetupTime.description: Whether to include venue-specific turnaround time

references.rationale: Physical impossibility - venue can only host one event at a time

constraints.description: Balance carry-over effects - the teams that play immediately after facing strong opponents. Prevents systematic disadvantage where some teams always play fatigued opponents while others face rested ones.

maxCarryOverImbalance.description: Maximum allowed difference in carry-over effect count between any two teams

weightByStrength.description: Weight carry-over by opponent strength (stronger = more impactful)

strengthField.description: Field in team object containing strength rating

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty increases quadratically with imbalance

references.rationale: Classic NP-hard constraint in sports scheduling - teams playing after strong opponents may face fatigued teams

constraints.description: Limit breaks (consecutive home or consecutive away games) in the schedule. A break occurs when a team plays two consecutive home or two consecutive away games.

maxBreaks.description: Maximum number of breaks allowed per team

maxConsecutiveSameVenueType.description: Maximum consecutive games at home or away (e.g., 2 = no triple home/away)

breakDefinition.description: Definition of what constitutes a break

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty doubles for each break beyond limit

references.rationale: Breaks create competitive imbalance - home advantage disruption affects fairness

constraints.description: Optimize travel patterns by clustering away games in the same region

preferRegionalClusters.description: Prefer scheduling consecutive away games in same region

clusterSize.description: Target number of games per regional cluster

regionField.description: Field in team/venue object containing region identifier

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty for each missed clustering opportunity

references.rationale: Reduces total travel distance and cost by grouping geographically proximate away games

constraints.description: Certain team pairs should have complementary home/away patterns (when one is home, other is away) to avoid broadcast conflicts

pairs.description: Pairs of team IDs that should have complementary patterns

mustBeOpposite.description: Whether patterns must be exactly opposite (strict) or just different (relaxed)

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty per round where complementary pattern is violated

references.rationale: Broadcast scheduling - avoid two popular teams both at home/away on same day

constraints.description: Ensure fair distribution of rest time between fixtures across teams

maxRestDifferenceHours.description: Maximum allowed rest time difference between teams in same fixture

considerOpponentStrength.description: Weight rest advantage more heavily when facing strong opponents

maxRestAdvantageVsStrongOpponent.description: Max rest advantage (hours) when playing top-tier teams

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty per hour of rest imbalance

references.rationale: Rest advantage significantly impacts competitive performance

constraints.description: Ensure phases occur in correct order with minimum gaps between them

before.description: Phase ID that must complete first

after.description: Phase ID that must start after

references.rationale: Tournament phases must occur in logical sequence

constraints.description: Ensure rounds are distributed evenly throughout the season with minimum/maximum gaps

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty per day outside allowed range

references.rationale: Even distribution ensures consistent schedule rhythm and rest

constraints.description: Require specific fixtures to kick off simultaneously (e.g., final round of group stage for fairness)

rounds.description: Round numbers that require simultaneous kick-off

tolerance_minutes.description: Allowed tolerance in minutes (0 = exact same time)

scope.description: Whether all games or only games within same group must be simultaneous

references.rationale: Prevents collusion/result manipulation in final rounds where outcomes interdepend
useCases: World Cup group stage final round
references.note: FIFA and UEFA mandate simultaneous kick-off for final group games

constraints.description: Avoid scheduling games within the same group at the same time to maximize broadcast windows

exceptFinalRound.description: Allow simultaneous games in final round (fairness override)

sameSlotLimit.description: Maximum games allowed in same time slot

slots.description: Time slots to monitor for conflicts

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty per broadcast slot conflict

references.rationale: Spread games across time slots to maximize viewership and ad revenue

constraints.description: Require specific fixture to be held at a specific venue

references.rationale: Finals and special matches often have designated venues

constraints.description: Apply special rules to specific phases (e.g., home advantage for top teams in final round)

rankingBasis.description: Basis for ranking teams for home advantage

defaultPenaltyModel.description: Penalty for violating phase-specific rules

references.rationale: Different phases may have different scheduling priorities
useCases: Final round home field for top teams

metadata.adoptionImpact: Vendors and researchers can implement constraints consistently with clear parameter schemas and penalty models
metadata.versioningPolicy: See VERSIONING.md for full policy. Semantic versioning applies. Breaking changes increment major version.
metadata.deprecationPolicy: Minimum 18 months notice before rule removal. See VERSIONING.md for full deprecation process.

statusValues.draft: Under development, may change without notice
statusValues.experimental: Available but unstable, may change in minor versions
statusValues.stable: Production-ready, backwards compatible within major version
statusValues.deprecated: Discouraged, will be removed after sunset date
statusValues.removed: No longer supported, will cause validation error if used
